meanings.definition: Musical instruments, such as the flute and clarinet, that produce sound by the vibration of reeds or the passage of air over a mouthpiece.
meanings.sent1: The woodwinds played a beautiful melody during the concert.
meanings.sent2: I love the sound of woodwinds in classical music.
meanings.sent3: The woodwinds whispered a secret tune to the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter floated through the room like a gentle woodwinds melody.
meanings.sent5: The woodwinds filled the air with their enchanting music.

meanings.definition: A section of an orchestra or band consisting of woodwind instruments.
meanings.sent1: The woodwinds section added a magical touch to the performance.
meanings.sent2: The conductor directed the woodwinds to play softly in the background.
meanings.sent3: The woodwinds section seemed to have a secret language of their own.
meanings.sent4: The woodwinds section danced together in perfect harmony.
meanings.sent5: The woodwinds section stood out with their unique sound.

meanings.definition: The woodwind section of an orchestra or band.
meanings.sent1: The woodwinds in the orchestra played a crucial role in the symphony.
meanings.sent2: The conductor raised his baton, signaling the woodwinds to begin.
meanings.sent3: The woodwinds section shared a knowing glance before starting to play.
meanings.sent4: The woodwinds section painted a colorful musical landscape.
meanings.sent5: The woodwinds section enchanted the audience with their melodies.
